title: Please, just.. no more.. please.
body:
I don't care wether he's _'broken'_, or wether he's _'useless unless he's in the right hands'_. I just don't care! 
But whatever it may be, can we please please please just not have a Yasuo 
in, every, single, game.

Everyone is just so over it now!

There are 151 champs in the game, there is absolutely no reason to have the same 1 champion in almost every game.

There is no fortuity here, the reason why we see so many Yasuo's in game now, is exactly that.
It would be fair to assume not many play a game to lose, which inherits the drive to win. When you want to win, you want as much edge on the competition as you can. Probably why I was never picked in dodge ball or the Aussie version of British bulldogs. I am the RL Urgot {{champion:6}}, just there to make the initial line up of numbers look impressive.

Call Yas what you will, it is because he has so much strength and utility at his disposal (some would say an 'edge' over most other champs) that he becomes the default pick because said player does not want to lose. And when someone has had enough of losing lane to a Yas, they decide why try beat a Yas, when I can BE the Yas. And it snowballs over time to what we see now, a Yasuo in every single game.

The ironic part of it all, is that we see changes on game modes with quotes like it "was stagnating super fast and had some unhealthy play patterns.", "Games quickly devolved into a slideshow of the 'perceived' best champs." and "seeing the same 20 champs every game got boring REAL fast." and change it to suit.

Of the 150 odd available champs in the game right now, we are still seeing the same champs every game.

It's not the game modes that are the problem, its the champions that are the problem.

The problem here is that you're wrong on many fronts.

Urgot is actually an AMAZING champion, with high damage while being quite tanky and a butt load of utility.

Yasuo has no utility. No team synergy.
All Yasuo is, is selfish damage.
This and his "edge lord" design are why people pick him.

Yasuo does disgusting amounts of damage, and unlike champions like Lee Sin who have a difficult kit to balance, Yasuo is simple to nerf.
Nerf his crit damage.
Hard lock it to the standard 200% and IE doesn't effect damage with it's passive.
Lower his base damage and heighten his scaling so people wont ever play him tank again like what was done with Ekko and Fizz.

Unfortunately Yasuo is one of the few champions who will NEVER be balanced because their overall design and the fact that they are played amazingly by the Pros generates a lot of cash for Riot, hence why Yasuo has gotten so many skins quickly compared to other champs.

See the issue with this, in my opinion at least, is there will always be champions that are stronger than the rest no matter how hard you nerf/balance them. 
There is always going to be annoying champions that come and go and thats just the nature of the game, eg. Soraka, Yi, Jhin, Rek'Sai. These are some champions that will just be strong no matter what and Yasuo is also one of these champions. The best way to deal with yasuo is learn him, know his power spikes and how to beat him.

Some yasou counters I quite like in low elo are defensive sustain cho'gath taking R>E>W>Q top rushing a RoA and frozen heart with merc boots and veigar mid, rushing a RoA and then as many tank items that give cdr as possible and stacking q and playing passively until he tries to all in you and then e, w, q, r dead since you have 3k hp, 150 armour and 600ap and nobody can fight you at this point.

i played tryndamere once, right, so i e'd into him, the i used w, then when i started getting low i used q, then used ult when i was getting low again and i just took down his shield

Play safe and have him Yas dash to you. Trynd is same as Yas 'kinda'.... but trynd has attack speed, crit and maybe life steal but yeah yas is a ridiculous champ. Tbh I sometime get frustrated when I play against a Yas like me as a Zed I outburst him but once I used my abilities then I can't do all else  since he can just dash to me and Q while I have to wait for my Q while auto'ing

Oh hohoho, ever since Yasuo has been released I've been dealing with his stupidity both in rank and norms, but I've learned to change my play style and properly know to counter him.

And the example you used: When a "dog sht that smells" from "dog shit that doesn't smell". A person may have a block nose and unable to smell and in the opposite case where he is able to smell similarly to Yasuo, if u played against yasuo's enough then you know how he will trade/engage/when he will use his abilities. You will have 'block' senses that hinders you from learning how to play against him and again the opposite where you are able to learn.

And yes like every single champ, the skill cap separates the good and the bad. Like how people played zed against me, because I know by playing the same champ I'm able to play against him and go in when his abilities are down.

Even if 100% of the yasuo's were shit, the sheer number of them is still a problem.
Either way, wether he is shit and ends up as 0/20 or is good and ends up as 20/0 theres still too many of both, and we don't want either option in every single game.

The things is, i used to main Yasuo (before the huge craze) and now i lane against him most games. I know how to play against him, but it doesn't matter most of the time, he will out-duel pretty much any non-assassin champion even without dashing around.

No ADC (except maybe Vayne) can out damage him in enough time to kill him in a duel, and even if they could he still has wind-wall. 
The few mages that can out damage him in less time than it takes for him to kill them, rely on skillshots and landing hard to hit cc.
No tank has enough damage to out-duel him, and his lifesteal makes thornmail redundant.
And if you can beat Yasuo as a support... well good luck to you.
So the only class of champion that can defeat him are the assassins, (and there're mostly a problem as well). 

Most of the time he doesn't even need to dash, he will just out damage you straight up by standing on you and attacking.
So your only option is to catch him out and outnumber him, and even then he usually kills at least 1 of you. 

In any case, the problem is not that he is too powerful the problem is that there are too many of them (good or bad).
Well, he has no skill cap, so if you're anywhere above level 9 you're almost guaranteed to find a GOOD Yasuo, which is every single one, since he's so EZ

No necessarily about skill cap (guess Im a bit in the wrong) but Yasuo is an easy champ to play but difficult to master the combos. And I've played with a low level player and seen some yasuo's but the thing is that they don't use their abilities to its full potential
